result.execSummary:
The defendant David Negron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: Any other sentence; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in an election until his civil rights are restored.
- Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Negron

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Negron in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve12 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 12 days time served.  
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 4/28/2016.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant David Negron in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant tested for Cocaine, and stated he took a pain pill that he did not have a prescription for.  Court does not modify bail at this time.  Court orders defendant to advise his agent of this violation.  Court will take defendant into custody and modify bail, if he tests positive again.  aw
Justice Point violation report, received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant David Negron in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Case scheduled for motion hearing.  Defense received additional information from the state, and believes their is no basis for motion hearing.  Defense withdraws motion and requests a plea date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/28/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's brief to defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Defendant David Negron in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a DISPOSITIVE MOTION.  State to respond by 3/10/2015.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 3/24/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
  Motion hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Notice of motion and motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Defendant David Negron in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has just received squad cam videos.  Case adjourned for defense to file a motion.  Case adjourned for 2/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to continue to make all contacts with Justice Point.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Court orders defendant released to Probation Agent.  All other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant David Negron not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is recalled on the record.  Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  BAIL AMENDED TO $250 SIGNATURE BOND.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court, in custody, with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Alex Mueller for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant David Negron in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  
Defendant David Negron in custody.  
Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 3.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
